alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 01 at 11:52AM MST until February 03 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM WEDNESDAY TO NOON MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches except between 5 and 10 inches above 7500 feet in Lincoln County. Areas of snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area, South Central Highlands, South Central Mountains, Guadalupe County, Eastern Lincoln County, and Southwest Chaves County. * WHEN...From 5 AM Wednesday to Noon MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40 near Albuquerque. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County
